Posts.EditableText: I just set down to start work on my game today and I can not open it. I get the message insted that my file has too many fatel errors on it. Can somebody tell me what this means and what I can do about it. Thank you, Dr. Froth
Posts.HTML:
I just set down to start work on my game today and I can not open it. I get the message insted that my file has too many fatel errors on it.

Can somebody tell me what this means and what I can do about it.

Thank you,

Dr. Froth

Posts.EditableText: Before you run the program (whether Quest or QuestNet Server), choose Options, go to the Logging tab, check "Log ASL script messages to a file", Browse to select the filename (make a new one like Error.log) and click OK. When you try to run the game and it doesn't work, go read the Error.log (or whatever you named it). This may give you a clue.
Posts.HTML: Before you run the program (whether Quest or QuestNet Server), choose Options, go to the Logging tab, check "Log ASL script messages to a file", Browse to select the filename (make a new one like Error.log) and click OK. When you try to run the game and it doesn't work, go read the Error.log (or whatever you named it). This may give you a clue.

Posts.EditableText:
I have done as you suggested and this is the response that the log got for me:

INIT: Quest 3.53
INIT: Opening file C:\Documents and Settings\The Froths\My Documents\Games\Quest adventures\MIkes Games\Inside the Murder House\Inside the Murder House.asl on 4/7/2006 at 10:28:22 PM
FATAL ERROR: Too many }
INIT: Unable to open file


Do you know what this means?
Thanks for the help.

Dr.Froth

Posts.EditableText: open your game in notepad and you will see the asl code. search through your game for '{', and check to see if every one has a '}' to close it. if you can't find it, post the code here and i'll find it for you.
Posts.HTML: open your game in notepad and you will see the asl code. search through your game for '{', and check to see if every one has a '}' to close it. if you can't find it, post the code here and i'll find it for you.

Posts.EditableText: Thank you so much, I have now fixed the problem and I'm back on track. If it was not for your help I would have been up the creek. Thanks again. Dr. Froth
